oai_dc:dc.dc:descriptions: The mouth of an Ostrich egg–shell not to be left open. By /han≠kass’o (L VIII.-25. 8234 rev. and 8235 rev.).
If an ostrich eggshell is left open (not stopped up with grass), the wind blows into its open mouth and a snake will go into the empty eggshell.
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: An ostrich eggshell, left open, will attract snakes
